Half life 2 is an amazing FPS shooter that tests, and improves on all the physics that it established in the firs game. The graphics may not be much, but the games plot and physics, and basically the entire game makes up for everything that it lacks in graphics. Here's the plot: Gordan Freeman, a scientist who was in the black messa accident, returns for this game, a long with a new adventure. This game is also only 10 Dollars! Its a nice game to play and to mess around with. I would recommend this game to EVERYONE who plays Valve games, or games like Portal. I would rate this game at a 4, and that's only because of its graphics.
Half-Life 2 is everything that reviewers say it is. It's truly the perfect PC game.
A classic even by  today's standards. a little slower than your traditional FPS but the puzzles are awesome.

This game is a sequel to one of the best games of all time and it became an iconic and most loved game aswell with it's fast paced combat, puzzle solving mechanics and interesting plot and characters.

This game is the best game I have ever played.

Half Life 2 is not just a game, its an experience. The world building is on the level of that which can only be seen in large cinematic universes these days such as Star Wars and Marvel. I would go as far as to say that Half Life 2 has changed me as a person. How could I not? A large portion of my life revolves around it now. I have most likely spent tens of thousands of hours doing half life 2 related things. Evidenced by my 10,000 hours on Garry's mod that is constantly growing I have spent an insane amount of time trying to re-immerse myself in this amazing world created by a company that has sadly fallen to being money driven and has stopped caring for its community. Despite the neglect and greedy nature of those who own the IP, the community still shines strong. Over 17 years after it's release and even prior to Alyx communities thrived in their passion for this masterpiece and created amazing works to expand this universe and make it their own. It really says something that I played this game, a game that came out the year I was born, and I was still amazed and changed because of it. This game, no, this experience is one you can not give up.

Oh my God, where do I begin? I had heard about this game for a long time now and I finally got around to joining the bandwagon and playing it. In this review, I'm going to explain why this game dethroned my now 2nd favorite game with such ease. 

1. The length. For how old this game is, it looks absolutely remarkable and is such a HUGE game! I never thought I could be playing it for such a long time, especially because of how short Portal was. I bought the Orange Box to play this game and the games after/during it just to find one of the world's greatest games.
2. The emotion. So much care has been put into this game by the development team. No matter what, your choices and decisions lead to consequences (not in the way a tell-tale game does it). If you threw a cup at someone, they respond. If you rush into a hoard of enemies expecting yourself to win, you die (unless you're playing easy, you baby-cake). Also, the way this game makes you feel is like none other. The voice acting, the animations, the upgrades all feel so damn good. I'm trying my best not to spoil anything for you and keeping out some of the little things so you can have the same experience I have.
3. The AI's. FINALLY, a game with good AI's. The enemies and team mates are so smart and I haven't seen such great artificial intelligence in my life! As you play, you see them interact with each other in a way that's so awesome and satisfying. I won't say anymore, like the reason I believe they're smart, so you don't get any more of it spoiled.
4. The progression. In this game, you learn as you play. This means that there's no stale moment and the game is constantly changing to keep it interesting. It begins at a sweet pace and ends at a sweet pace. The ending also shows the same progression and consequences of your choices, which is a true treasure to behold.

Overall, this game is spectacular and was definitely way ahead of its time of 2004 (My birth year). However, like any other game, there are some flaws. In some parts, the colors seemed a bit bright, but I guess that's better than being too dull. Also, as you played, the colors shifted back to normal. This only occurred in like 2 or 3 moments, but only lasted a couple minutes. The last flaw I had was your knowledge. Sometimes, I didn't know where to go because either a ladder was blended into a wall, or I was just flat-out forgetful in some moments. This is still better than a game with arrows in the middle of your screen telling you where to go. These flaws are very small and get worked out the more your eyes adjust to the game. I would have said the ladders were a flaw, but it didn't seem that extreme. The ladders are a bit confusing to work around, but easy to master. Sometimes, you will automatically move onto a platform from the ladder, but you may need to press E to get off on certain points of the ladder.

PS. You may need to adjust the resolution settings a bit so the game looks better. I use the last resolution setting on full-screen and this looks great!

Valve, thank you so much for this gem and I now understand the hype for Alyx as this is the best game I've ever put into my library. To all that's reading this right now, this game will be a joy for you to play and will never fail to impress you! This was a spectacular experience, and I definitely plan on playing Episode 1 and 2 next. I've also got to check out the 1st game as well :/

Best campaign I have ever played.

Half-Life 2 is an amazing person shooter that broke many boundaries at the time of its release, with a state of the art physics engine and novelties like the gravity gun that take full advantage of it, extremely fun run and gun game play with a huge wealth of weapons and tools to dispatch enemies. Almost every weapon in this game feels good to use, but I think what I found to be the most fun was picking up objects off the ground with the gravity gun and using them to kill enemies. The game is almost like a sandbox in some ways and some sections where you can pick and choose your preferred way of clearing a room or section of the game. The story is a typical humanity enslaved by an alien race trope, but its done well and it really never gets in the way of game play. Considering this game is over 15 years old at this point it has aged incredibly well, and feels better to play than a lot of first person shooters released in the past few years. My only complaints with this game would probably have to be the vehicle sections, mainly because I feel like they overstay their welcome and last entirely too long. Overall, the game flows well outside of that and feels genuinely fun to play from start till finish. A genre defining classic that will never be forgotten.
Finally finished Half Life 2 after decades of false starts. It does not disappoint. A thrill ride through and through, the game holds up even all these years later. Massive recommend.
